security: Disclosing the names and roles of current and former CIA personnel, as well as the Agency's use of commercial firms for cover purposes, could compromise intelligence operations and endanger individuals. Specific examples include 'James Corbin Fitchett entered on duty with the Agency in early 1952, and is currently a GS-13, Security Officer' and 'Robert R. Mullen and Company has been utilized by the Central Cover Staff since 1963'. Revealing these connections could lead to the exposure of sensitive assets and methods.
summary: A report detailing the CIA connections to individuals and organizations involved in the Watergate break-in, including current and former Agency employees, cover organizations, and related individuals.
summary_one_paragraph: This report, dated June 1972, provides an overview of the CIA connections to individuals and organizations linked to the Watergate break-in. It identifies current and former Agency staff members, such as James W. McCord, Jr., E. Howard Hunt, Jr., James Corbin Fitchett, and Ralph Orlando True, and outlines their relationships with the Committee for the Re-election of President Nixon, McCord Associates, and other entities. The report also details the Agency's utilization of cover organizations like Robert R. Mullen and Company and General Foods Corporation, noting the involvement of key personnel and the nature of their support. Additionally, it lists individuals and organizations mentioned in the Watergate investigation for which Agency records are either negative or contain no pertinent information.
title: Entry into Democratic National Headquarters
